text: I'm new to modern languages. One suggestion: In a Tutorial *Part 1*, please don't use the same name for different purposes. You named the  "package" main (whatever a "package" is), then you named the func "main". Now for a beginner like me, it is not clear whether this is just coincidence, or whether it is required to have equal names. Maybe for a pro that is a silly question, and maybe after looking Part 14 it becomes obvious. But if it is not a requirement, why not use different names just for clarity.
